citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: United States Urbanized Areas, 2008

serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States Urbanized Areas is a polygon theme representing urban areas in the United States derived from the urban areas layer of the Digital Chart of the World (DCW).
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States Urbanized Areas provides information about the locations, names, and populations of urbanized areas for conducting geographic analysis on national and large regional scales.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:1,500,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:

For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was originally extracted from the Digital Chart of the World at 1:1,000,000-scale with some geospatial data from a USGS 1:2,000,000-scale hydrography layer. It was updated several times using various sources whose horizontal positional accuracies are unknown.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: Urban Areas of the United States, 2008
citeinfo.othercit: The data set was downloaded from the web site in August 2002.

procstep.procdesc:
Urban polygons from the Digital Chart of the World (DCW) CD-ROM were extracted and converted to Arc/INFO format. Where the urban boundaries extended beyond the shoreline of State Boundaries of the United States, the shoreline was matched to the State Boundaries of the United States shoreline. Names of the urban areas were added using names in Cities and Towns of the United States (1998). In large metropolitan areas many smaller areas were labeled as part of the metropolitan area. The State in which the urban area is located was also added. Several areas were modified to conform to the 1:2,000,000-scale hydrography (Hydrography Features of the United States) layer. Some smaller polygons that represent undeveloped areas within the urban area were removed and merged with the larger urban area. Military reservations were also removed. Finally, the attribute for State FIPS was added.
The spellings for San Francisco, CA and Bismarck, ND were corrected.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded the ArcView GIS Shapefile compressed file, urbanap020.tar.gz, from the National Atlas of the United States and extracted it. Added POPULATION attribute from ESRI Data & Maps 2002 U.S. National Atlas Urbanized Areas and coded the values for the 44 records that did not find a match to -999. Corrected misspelled cities in the NAME attribute. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Changed one feature NAME from 'Otterbein' in CA to 'Rowland Heights'.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Changed one feature NAME from 'Vaaldosta' in GA to 'Valdosta'.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent boundaries for places in the United States where concentrated populations exist.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The name of the urban area.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for each state in which the urban area is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for each state in which the urban area is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The population of the urban area.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey
